lines: (During the gruelling battle, Krokos' magic kept everyone's morale high.)
(By the end, the Crown Mages and refugees defeated the bandits.)

lines.Volesus: "I didn't expect such a powerful blessing! I felt fearless and unbeatable! High Priest Krokos really does live up to his reputation."

lines.Vitus: "Even so, a lot of people got injured during the fight."

lines.Krokos: "No matter how you look at it, you cannot fight without getting hurt."
"One could say that constantly assuming the responsibility of others could be viewed as remarkably self-centred."
"And that it could get annoying very quickly."

lines.Volesus: "Right, well, at least no one died!"

lines: (Krokos finished the death curse incantation, and the group arrive at the bandit's roadblock stronghold.)
(Lifeless bodies were strewn about the interior. Only a few maimed souls survived.)
(Frightened by the destruction, the bandits succumbed to a fear-induced haze.)

lines.Volesus: "Amazing... they were all torn asunder just like that..."

lines.Vitus: "There are still survivors among the bandits, but they hardly look like they're about to fight back."

lines.Krokos: "And permanently scarred. You could say it is a lesson of some sort."

lines.Volesus: "Even so, this magic is really impressive!"

lines.Vitus: "I didn't mean to downplay the power of the spell. It's just that... we've also suffered a few casualties."

lines.Krokos: "This was wild, destructive magic at work."
"There's more often a price to pay."
"But I do not recall saying that you had a part to play in that equation."
"Nobody did, in fact. Not a soul."

lines.Vitus: "What should we do about the injured.

lines.Mukaki: "Do I even have to say it? It is clear that we should—"

lines.Makari-Hari: "This is definitely my area of expertise."
"—We should, of course, summon Cerkles to treat the wounded."

lines.Volesus: "Hey! I know him! Cerkles the Chirurgeon!"

lines.Vitus: "You sure are a nerd for these Heroes."

lines.Volesus: "What do you mean? This was all taught to us!"

lines.Vitus: "Yes— I know that, and I know you're a nerd."

lines.Volesus: "So, do we have the artfact needed to summon him?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "Please use the laural to begin the Ritaul of Summoning."

lines.Volesus: "So Cerkles' artefact is a laural... he did wear on in the paintings but—"
"For someone so great to leave a legacy so dull and weathered..."

lines.Mukaki: "Surely you'd think one of the Crown Mages would have the deceny to buff the metal once a century or so."

lines.Volesus: "Our mentor never told us what it really was..."

lines.Vitus: "Volesus, I think you should summon this one."

lines.Volesus: "I'm on it!"

lines: (Confidently, Volesus draws the magic circle and places the laurel crown upon it. Reciting the incantation, a flash of light leaves a broad white figure materialised before them."

lines.Cerkles: "Healer Cerkles, your call is my duty..."

lines.Volesus: "Cerkles—father of medicine—please lend us your assistance!"

lines.Cerkles: "Huh... Herclaus? And Krokos? And the two demiurges..."

lines.Herclaus: "It's complicated. Let's tend to the injured first."

lines.Cerkles: "Oh... okay, please take me to them."

lines: (Cerkles approaches a nearby wounded man, placing his paw against his lacerated flesh.)
(The chirurgeon mutters a few words, and when he takes his paw away, the skin and fur of the wounded sealed without a scar.)

lines.Volesus: "As expected of Cerkles!"
"That technique is nothing less than a miracle!"

lines.Vitus: "Don't you use herbs? I thought you were in capable of spellcasting..."

lines.Volesus: "True, no legend I know told of Cerkles using magic."
"It has me curious."

lines.Cerkles: "Herbs can be useful... but what do you mean by magic?"
"Magic and healing are one and the same."

lines.Volesus: "He couldn't mean..."

lines.Vitus: "Then... what about herbal treatment?"

lines.Cerkles: "Could true medicine have been lost to this era?"

lines.Mukaki: "For your knowledge, the medicine you employ is indeed magic."
"Magic has been lost to most in this era."

lines.Cerkles: "Why aren't people capable of magic anymore? I'm sorry, I don't..."

lines.Mukaki: "Hmph— Ask Makari-Hari if you want his excuse."

lines.Vitus: "Sorry to interrupt— I have something to say about the injured."
"The bandits here are also gravely injured. If left alone, it's likely they will die."

lines.Cerkles: "I wasn't sure if I was supposed to..."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Of course you should! No one deserves to die this way!"

lines.Mukaki: "Why would you try to save the men who attacked our Crown Mages?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "If they're to be executed, they should be brought to justice before making that decision!"

lines.Mukaki: "You're getting on my nerves. Why bother with the song and dance? Death is their justice."

lines.Makari-Hari: "This is a matter of principle! I will not tolerate a massacre!"

lines.Mukaki: "Fine, let's say we do as you want."
"Will you personally carry these men who want us dead to the city to stand trial?"

lines.Cerkles: "I— um, I can induce a coma to sedate them during transport."

lines.Mukaki: "Then we'd need to leave someone to stand guard until they can be moved! It's a complete waste of effort!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "Upholding your principles is worth whatever effort."

lines.Mukaki: "What is the matter with your brain?! These men want to hurt and kill!"

lines.Vitus: "Please, I've told you both to stop fighting."
"Do we really need to pick siges again?"

lines.Volesus: "Let's just get this over with. Vitus, which side do you prefer?"
"Is that so? I still think Mukaki has a point."
"I don't love the idea of wasting time on highwaymen willing to slice innocent people to bits, so you might find some resistance."

lines.Vitus: "We just have to convince the others, right?"

lines: (Vitus convinced the other to let Cerkles heal and incapacitate the bandits to await lawful judgment.)

lines.Vitus: "Although it may be a burden on all of us, we should heal them."
"If we have the means to let the law judge them, we should follow through on them."

lines.Volesus: "Is that so? I still think Makari-Hari has a point."
"We don't know in this group was fighting out of greed, or through fear and coercion."

lines.Vitus: "We just have to convince the others, right?"

lines: (Vitus convinces the others to continue onwards, leaving the bandits to the justice of their demise.)

lines.Vitus: "Though this is a difficult choice... we'll need to leave them be."
"It's not our responsibility to preserve their lives when they chose to attack and prey on us."
"We don't need to risk endangering ourselves or the refugees who ca't fight."
